snippet: Islamic State social media accounts said the group was responsible for the attack, which came as opposing sides of the Syrian conflict were gathered in Geneva for talks.
abstract: Insurgents meet for first time with United Nations mediator in Geneva to begin peace talks with Syrian government; will ask for release of prisoners and end to food blockades and excessive bombings; settlement between government and rebels is crucial to overall effort to defeat Islamic State extremists, who recently attacked area close to Shiite shrine Sayeda Zeinab near Damascus.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and SOMINI SENGUPTA
byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Geneva, and Steven Lee Myers from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Islamic State social media accounts said the group was responsible for the attack, which came as opposing sides of the Syrian conflict were gathered in Geneva for talks.

headline.main: Syria Peace Talks Inch Ahead as Bombings Near Damascus Continue
headline.print_headline: Syria Talks Inch Ahead as Fighting Continues

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
